body: clintasha + dodging explosions

trail.content_raw: clintasha + dodging explosions
trail.content: clintasha + dodging explosions

body:
daddy stark

can you imagine what tony said to her daughter before he left to throw himself back in time knowing he could very well die or kill everyone!! because it’s hurting me so much rn

- imagine if it’s still really early in the morning so tony creeps into his daughters bedroom bc he wouldn’t leave without saying goodbye, so he ruffles her hair gently and whisper-shouts her name to maybe let her hear him

- but morgan’s still too sleepy to really wake up and he just shakes his head and chuckles and says smth like “daddy’s going to fight some bad guys, ok? i’ll be back soon” and morgan just “mmmmmmnnhmm” s a little bit bc she’s half asleep

- and tony smiles and walks to the door, but after he opens it he just looks back at her sleeping mess of a daughter and watches her for a little while, then says softly “i love you 3000” before walking out

all the while thinking of how he could die, but even if he does he knows he’s told her daughter how much he loves her, because you can’t say it too much.

and then morgan hates herself because she wasn’t awake for her last goodbye with her dad uhahhah

body:
tell me a story. pt1 ?

- what hurts about morgan is that she didn’t even fully know what was going on yet, i mean look at the funeral scene, she wasn’t crying or anything, she didn’t seem that sad, because she’s barely 5 for gods sakes.

- she probably doesn’t know what death is, peppers definitely going to talk to her about it but maybe for a while she’s still waiting for tony to come back, because he’s just away fighting some bad guys and he’ll be back soon after he wins, right?

- when she grows older and realises that he’s not coming back, then she starts seeing her friends dads picking them up from school, their dads playing catch, teaching them games, she sees those dads coming for ceremonies and plays, and maybe if she dances she’ll see dads coming for recitals.

- and somewhere in her heart she grows resentful, because her dad died and left her while all the other dads were still here, and it’s not fair. it’s not fair that her dad would do this to her, why couldn’t it be someone else.

- all this time there are people, even teachers in school tell her that her father was iron man, telling her how great her father was, how he saved the entire universe, but it doesn’t help, because she thinks her dad didn’t care about her. she doesn’t want iron man, she just wants her dad.

- pepper understands, and she tells her stories of tony stark instead. tony stark, not iron man. she tells her about how he dreamed about morgan, how he dreamt that they named her after pepper’s “eccentric uncle”. funny stories, about how tony once bought a giant bunny for pepper and his first trial runs for his iron man suit, and how he treated his robots as his kids “If you douse me again, and I’m not on fire, I’m donating you to a city college.“ and morgan would giggle, despite the pain and the tears in her eyes, and pepper would start laughing, and in the middle of the night, where everything is still, they would sit on the bed laughing as they found the tiniest bit of joy in those memories.

- there were also stories about how tony stark was a great man. how he discovered / rediscovered a whole new element in a day, how he figured out time travel in just a night. how he was a mad genius, but also how he tried to change the world for the better, not just as iron man. how tony stark was a brave, generous man who always tried his best and always put others before himself. how as much as he was a mad genius, he would still say the dumbest things.

- on other nights, she would hold her close as they sat on her bed and she would tell her stories of how tony had a biggest heart. how tony swore to protect pepper, the one thing he couldn’t live without, and how happy he was the night morgan told him she loved him “3000”. how tony loved and cared about his family, how he once ordered the suit to save pepper first when the house was crashing down. those were the most painful nights, but those were when they felt like tony was with them. they would sit in silence, only broken by an occasional sniff, and in the dark, they could feel him sitting there too, smiling at them. and on those nights, when they slowly drifted asleep, they could hear him whispering “i love you 3000”

- and then there was peter. petey, her older brother that she heard stories of from her dad. tony only started telling them to her in the last year, but every time he would leave with tears in his eyes and he would smile and turn off the lights to hide them, but morgan never knew what made her dad so sad.

- this time, though, it was petey telling the stories. whenever he visited, he would tuck her into bed and she would hold his hand and whisper “tell me a story, pete”. he told her about the times he lied to “mr stark” but ended up needing him to save the day anyway. he told her about the time they first met, how tony turned up in his apartment and tried to wink with a black eye, how he called petey “spider-boy”. he told her how tony never called peter “peter”, how he turned himself into a rocket to shoot himself out to space just to save peter. how tony made peter a new suit the moment he discovered nanotech, how he tried to send peter back to earth with a parachute.

- there were more intimate stories, of how tony was more than a role model or a mentor, he became a father to petey. how he yelled and parented him, how he tried so hard not to be another howard stark, and how he encouraged him when superheroing got too hard. and when petey turned off the lamp and kissed her forehead, ignoring how she groaned at the affection, she could see the glistening in his eyes, illuminated by the moonlight peeking through the curtains, and his voice would shake a little when he said “gnight morg, sleep tight, i love you”.

- it wasn’t just her mom and petey, though. there was uncle rhodey and happy, and somehow they made things easier.

- and with these stories, morgan grew older. she stopped resenting her dad, because she realised that beyond iron man, there was tony stark, and he was more of a hero than iron man could ever be. she understood how much her dad loved her, and how he died, not just to save everyone, but to save her. to make sure that the world she grew up in was safer, with one less purple giant guy to worry about. but without the anger, the hollow space seemed to get louder. because taking the place of anger would be sadness.

- she would listen to all these stories of her dad, and slowly realise that all she knew of her dad was through stories. other people’s stories, not hers, because she never got the chance to be in stories. and she would realise that those 4 years she had with her dad were slowly fading away. she couldn’t remember much about the way he stroked her hair, or the way he looked at her like she was a little genius. she knew all these stories of her dad, but she couldn’t even remember him.

(wrote this on a spur so it’s really bad and incomplete because i lost the feels somewhere near the end so i just ended it) heh

summary: Men in Black International and Shaft Both Fail to Meet Expectations as MiB Wins the Weekend
title: Men in Black International and Shaft Both Fail to Meet Expectations as MiB Wins the Weekend
body:
Men in Black International and Shaft Both Fail to Meet Expectations as MiB Wins the Weekend #movies #MiB

It was a bad weekend at the box office as Men in Black International and Shaft didn’t come close to even the lowest expectations. The weekend was down

Men in Black Internationalopened with $28.5 million which is the lowest opening for the franchise by over $20 million. All three previous films opened with over $51 million. The film received a “B” CinemaScore and middling to negative…

View On WordPress

blog.name: aletheiarynne
blog.title: Sleeping internally, externally and eternally.
blog.description: When I figure it out, I'll let you know. Also, I write. On ao3. And I'm Team Iron Man.

title: Endgame and therapy
body: Suffice it to say watching Avengers: Endgame did some things to my mental stability (read: destroyed it). Here’s a thing that happened during therapy today that’s kinda blown my mind: My therapist asked me why I love Tony Stark so much that I cried for ten days straight when he died. She said that nobody’s perfect. I told her that’s why I loved him, because he had flaws and worked hard to overcome them. And then she asked me why I couldn’t love myself despite being imperfect when I could love him for the same reason. I didn’t have an answer.

trail.content_raw: Suffice it to say watching Avengers: Endgame did some things to my mental stability (read: destroyed it). Here’s a thing that happened during therapy today that’s kinda blown my mind: My therapist asked me why I love Tony Stark so much that I cried for ten days straight when he died. She said that nobody’s perfect. I told her that’s why I loved him, because he had flaws and worked hard to overcome them. And then she asked me why I couldn’t love myself despite being imperfect when I could love him for the same reason. I didn’t have an answer.
trail.content: Suffice it to say watching Avengers: Endgame did some things to my mental stability (read: destroyed it). Here’s a thing that happened during therapy today that’s kinda blown my mind: My therapist asked me why I love Tony Stark so much that I cried for ten days straight when he died. She said that nobody’s perfect. I told her that’s why I loved him, because he had flaws and worked hard to overcome them. And then she asked me why I couldn’t love myself despite being imperfect when I could love him for the same reason. I didn’t have an answer.

body:
no trust liar (endgame things)

what really bothered me when i watched endgame was the scene where tony lashed out at steve. first off, I completely agree that steve had that coming, it was such an emotional and powerful scene because tony came back from almost certain death, he was tired and grieving, and cap was asking him for coordinates like that was the most important thing. and at that point tony’s too tired to hold all that back anymore and what comes out of it was so heart wrenching and true and he really gave all he had. but that’s not the point, what bothered me was steve’s reaction, or rather the lack of it. maybe that’s just steve’s character and maybe i’m just not that familiar with him, but that look on his face and how he just stood there kind of hurt.

firstly the look on his face, it wasn’t just stoic, it was the look you give to a child or some annoying animal being unreasonable. the pity and the disregard and that looking down (wow i forgot the word for this) made me so mad, as if he thought of tony as some deranged person or some angry resentful child. again, this might be completely off but it’s just what i felt when i first watched the movie.

second was how he didn’t say a single word. maybe that was his way of showing apology, by letting tony take it out on him, but again i felt it was just that he didn’t even bother to respond to tony. to me, tony was definitely just trying to let everything out, but a tiny part was also to get something out of steve, to hurt him. but steve didn’t apologise, didn’t show he was angry or hurt or sad, and imo that silence was the worst insult. not just that he thought tony wasn’t worth replying to, but that he didn’t even take tony seriously.

and also, how steve completely disregarded that tony literally just walked out of a spaceship he was sure he was going to die in, thinking and praying that pepper, rhodey, happy and the rest of them lived, after losing to thanos and watching all the people he fought with turn to dust. he might have had time to process everything and deal with it, but tony was busy dying and thinking that he didn’t need to process anything since he was going to die anyway. so when captain marvel showed up and saved them, it was the first time tony had the time or need to think and grieve and steve comes in like the chill guy he is and starts grinding him for coordinates or anything useful. like in that state with that much guilt and pain and having everything crash on him when he came back, he already wasn’t emotionally stable and steve couldn’t even see that his Friend was in pain before trying to get something out of him was kind of sickening, honestly.

this scene was definitely a really good scene, especially with rdj’s performance and also for tony’s character and it was one that i thought steve deserved for a really long time, but idk i just felt like steve’s response was cold and disrespectful and hurtful

summary:
When Tony faces failure, he is disappointed in himself and he works to improve himself.
When Thanos faces failure, he is...
body:
When Tony faces failure, he is disappointed in himself and he works to improve himself.

When Thanos faces failure, he is disappointed in others and works to “improve” them.

summary: Would Clint and Natasha ever had made a good married couple?  I swear there was romantic tension between them always.  I was...
question: Would Clint and Natasha ever had made a good married couple?  I swear there was romantic tension between them always.  I was shocked when it was discovered Clint had a wife in Age of Ultron.
answer: clintasha is a huge and precious ship, but i do think that their personalities would have crashed a lot. they both are so self sacrificing and care for each other so much that neither of them are able to give in for the other person (cough cough endgame cough). but i absolutely love how close they are throughout the series. they are each other’s strong pillars and wouldn’t be able to fully exist without each other. however, my thought is that i don’t know if they would be able to be married without destroying each other.

blog.name: blackwidows-backup
blog.title: Marvel Obsessed
blog.description: I'm obsessed with all things Marvel.

summary:
You know what, you people can hate on the scene where the mcu women gather around to protect Peter Parker.
You can hate on it...
body:
You know what, you people can hate on the scene where the mcu women gather around to protect Peter Parker.

You can hate on it all you want.

I will never not love it.

It’s not even about the feminism or whatever, it’s just an awesome f*cking clip and you guys need to move past the whole stupid argument and just look and see how perfect and beautiful the actual scene is.

Honestly, the more posts about how awful and “forced” it is, the more times I want to go watch it illegally on YouTube, and the more times I see how f*cking awesome it is.

I will thrive off your hate and laugh all the way to the dvd section of Walmart.

From: someone that needs to blow off some steam

tags: dunno i’ve had this saved forever and i wanted to post
this is NOT a fix it fic oops
summary:
“Mr. Stark…”
Peter’s voice faltered as he fell to his knees beside you, the aftermath of the final battle against Thanos evident...
body:
“Mr. Stark…”

Peter’s voice faltered as he fell to his knees beside you, the aftermath of the final battle against Thanos evident in the dirt and dust surrounding him. Every gust of wind brought an unwelcome feeling. One that he could only describe as bittersweet and unnerving as he watched the Titan disappear. With wide eyes, everyone saw him turn to ash along with his army and after that, there was nothing but a deafening silence.

“Dad? H-hey?” You tried too, leaning in closer and placing your hand gently on his cheek.

Just a little bit longer, Tony thought. He needed to stay just a little bit longer. For you, your sister, and Pepper. For Peter. Rhodey and Steve. He was doing the best he could, each breath he took was now numbered but he knew that he had to hold on. Even though his eyes fought to close and the glow of the reactor in his chest dimmed, he couldn’t go just yet. He turned his head with all the strength he had left toward you and the boy who had managed to weasel his way into whatever broken shards of Tony’s heart were left.

“Can you hear me?” Your shoulders sagged and your heart felt heavy with each breath you wished you could give to him and you wanted to be strong. Because he had always taught you to be but you couldn’t. With Peter’s arm around your waist, he held you as if it were enough and you started to cry more.

“Dad, no. Please. We- we won. You did it!”

You were having a hard time finding the silver lining. You won but did you really? When you were in the midst of losing so much more with every second that passed. How could it really be considered a victory if the consequence was losing the very best of the team? The best parts of you?

As your tears continued to fall, you placed your hand on Tony’s arm, pleading with him silently to just say something. You remained hopeful until the very last second, watching as the ugly shade of black creeped farther up your father’s face and gasps for air he was taking in between pale white lips became grave and unsteady.

The others were now surrounding you, standing amongst the wreckage of the facility that they could no longer call home. Under the orange glow and dark clouds in the sky it was like the whole world fell silent, as if for one moment, all and any noise ceased to exist, seeming to already mourn their fallen hero.

Peter hangs his head, looking up through his own wet lashes and between sobs, he whispers, “I’m sorry, Tony.”

All he wanted was to hear Tony’s voice fill the silence. For him to tell him that it would be okay, that he was okay and that yes. They won. But he knew he couldn’t. He never would again and all that mattered to him now, was you.

But it was Pepper who, with a gentle hand on his shoulder, pulled Peter up and into her arms for just a second before she took his place next to you.

“Tony…

Look at me.”

You closed your eyes, listening to your mother’s voice as she tried to be strong for the both of you. She sounded calm but this was after the storm and it didn’t make any sense to you. There was fire and metal, dust and fog for miles and yet she was as gentle as ever.

Her hand came up to cover the glow in his chest with shaking fingers slowly sliding between his and he turned his head with all the strength he had left.

“We’re gonna be okay,” Pepper nodded, reassuring him and you did the same even though it truly felt like you never would be again. She placed her hand on the reactor, hiding the faint glow as he lifted his. He slowly looked at the both of you; his two favorite girls. He knew you would be okay. He always told you that you got your strength from your mother, because he never considered himself strong except he was and it rang clear in his last words.

I am… Iron Man.

“Tony…

Look at me.”

You closed your eyes, listening to your mother’s voice as she tried to be strong for the both of you. She sounded calm but this was after the storm and it didn’t make any sense to you. There was fire and metal, dust and fog for miles and yet she was as gentle as ever.

Her hand came up to cover the glow in his chest with shaking fingers slowly sliding between his and he turned his head with all the strength he had left.

“We’re gonna be okay,” Pepper nodded, reassuring him and you did the same even though it truly felt like you never would be again. She placed her hand on the reactor, hiding the faint glow as he lifted his. He slowly looked at the both of you; his two favorite girls. He knew you would be okay. He always told you that you got your strength from your mother, because he never considered himself strong except he was and it rang clear in his last words.

I am… Iron Man.
trail.content:
“Mr. Stark…”

Peter’s voice faltered as he fell to his knees beside you, the aftermath of the final battle against Thanos evident in the dirt and dust surrounding him. Every gust of wind brought an unwelcome feeling. One that he could only describe as bittersweet and unnerving as he watched the Titan disappear. With wide eyes, everyone saw him turn to ash along with his army and after that, there was nothing but a deafening silence.

“Dad? H-hey?” You tried too, leaning in closer and placing your hand gently on his cheek.

Just a little bit longer, Tony thought. He needed to stay just a little bit longer. For you, your sister, and Pepper. For Peter. Rhodey and Steve. He was doing the best he could, each breath he took was now numbered but he knew that he had to hold on. Even though his eyes fought to close and the glow of the reactor in his chest dimmed, he couldn’t go just yet. He turned his head with all the strength he had left toward you and the boy who had managed to weasel his way into whatever broken shards of Tony’s heart were left.

“Can you hear me?” Your shoulders sagged and your heart felt heavy with each breath you wished you could give to him and you wanted to be strong. Because he had always taught you to be but you couldn’t. With Peter’s arm around your waist, he held you as if it were enough and you started to cry more.

“Dad, no. Please. We- we won. You did it!”

You were having a hard time finding the silver lining. You won but did you really? When you were in the midst of losing so much more with every second that passed. How could it really be considered a victory if the consequence was losing the very best of the team? The best parts of you?

As your tears continued to fall, you placed your hand on Tony’s arm, pleading with him silently to just say something. You remained hopeful until the very last second, watching as the ugly shade of black creeped farther up your father’s face and gasps for air he was taking in between pale white lips became grave and unsteady.

The others were now surrounding you, standing amongst the wreckage of the facility that they could no longer call home. Under the orange glow and dark clouds in the sky it was like the whole world fell silent, as if for one moment, all and any noise ceased to exist, seeming to already mourn their fallen hero.

Peter hangs his head, looking up through his own wet lashes and between sobs, he whispers, “I’m sorry, Tony.”

All he wanted was to hear Tony’s voice fill the silence. For him to tell him that it would be okay, that he was okay and that yes. They won. But he knew he couldn’t. He never would again and all that mattered to him now, was you.

But it was Pepper who, with a gentle hand on his shoulder, pulled Peter up and into her arms for just a second before she took his place next to you.

“Tony…

Look at me.”

You closed your eyes, listening to your mother’s voice as she tried to be strong for the both of you. She sounded calm but this was after the storm and it didn’t make any sense to you. There was fire and metal, dust and fog for miles and yet she was as gentle as ever.

Her hand came up to cover the glow in his chest with shaking fingers slowly sliding between his and he turned his head with all the strength he had left.

“We’re gonna be okay,” Pepper nodded, reassuring him and you did the same even though it truly felt like you never would be again. She placed her hand on the reactor, hiding the faint glow as he lifted his. He slowly looked at the both of you; his two favorite girls. He knew you would be okay. He always told you that you got your strength from your mother, because he never considered himself strong except he was and it rang clear in his last words.

I am… Iron Man.

summary: I was talking to one of my "friends" about marvel movies and he.was trying to figure out the order of them all. So he asks some...
body:
I was talking to one of my “friends” about marvel movies and he.was trying to figure out the order of them all. So he asks some kids around us and they’re like oh we haven’t seen them all

This boy starts freaking out cuz “how dare you watch End Game but not the rest of the movies” and like calling them fake fans

So I’m like don’t worry at least I’ve seen all the marvel movies

Then later I go to bring up a scene from into the spiderverse and he’s like no spoilers I haven’t seen it. Then proceeds to tell me that he’s not gonna watch it because it’s not part of the MCU so it doesn’t matter

Anyway I took pride in calling him a fake fan

summary: How on earth is the government post endgame going to handle things like people’s ages? they would have a bunch of 13 to 17 year...
body: How on earth is the government post endgame going to handle things like people’s ages? they would have a bunch of 13 to 17 year olds who according to their date of birth are adults, some of whom are even “old enough” to purchase alcohol.

blog.name: blackwidows-backup
blog.title: Marvel Obsessed
blog.description: I'm obsessed with all things Marvel.

body:
Carol & Rhodey

So you guys know how in the comics, Rhodey and Carol are canonically dating?

Well remember that one scene from Iron Man 3?

~~~

Tony: You ever had a chick straddling you and you look up and suddenly she’s glowing from the inside out, kind of a bright orange?

Rhodey: Yeah. I’ve had that.

~~~

Now, chances are, he was just being sarcastic for humor reasons and whatnot.

But WHAT IF?

WHAT IF Carol came back to earth and they met and just… WHAT IF?

blog.name: girlysword
blog.title: Girlysword
blog.description: If you should ever think me smart, don't be fooled. I am better talking about things than doing them.

summary: MCU Black Widow is Han Solo done right A character gets killed off and gets a solo prequel movie soon after, sound familiar? 1)...
body:
MCU Black Widow is Han Solo done right

A character gets killed off and gets a solo prequel movie soon after, sound familiar?

1) There is an excellent post somewhere talking about how Natasha is one the most consistently written characters in the MCU and one of her most consistent traits is how much she cares about her friends. Her death in Endgame was that character trait fulfilled. So her death was character-driven. Han Solo was killed to release Harrison Ford from the obligation of doing any more Star Wars movies.

2) The same actor is doing the solo movie rather than asking audiences to accept an entirely new version of the character,

3) Fans have been clamoring for a Black Widow solo movie for years. There had been no outcry for a Han Solo movie before it was announced.
